availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, silversmith. Ohio native. Son of William Steele. Enlisted as Sergeant in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry in Henderson, Kentucky, on October 28, 1861. Mortally wounded at Fort Donelson, Tennessee, on February 15, 1862.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 11. Cyrus Steele, Compiled Service Record, NARA M398, Compiled service records of volunteer Union soldiers who served in organizations from the State of Kentucky, Roll 373.
